sac.game

Interface RefutationTable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RefutationTableAsHashMap, RefutationTableAsTreeMap, RefutationTableImpl

    public interface RefutationTable
    Common interface for refutation table containers. The purpose of a refutation table is to keep information about such moves - (parent, child) pairs - that led to the best payoff for given parent or even caused a cut-off in the previous search iteration. This information can be taken advantage of in the future and be used to reorder children in the next search iteration (hoping from sooner cut-offs). Typically, a refutation table should keep inside two collections - 'save collection' (meant for saving entries for next tree search iteration), and 'read collection' (meant for reading entries from previous tree search iteration).
    Author:
    Przemysław Klęsk (wi.zut.edu.pl), Marcin Korzeń (wi.zut.edu.pl)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the whole transposition table.
      double getDepthLimit()
      Returns the depth limit (up to which entries are memorized).
      int getUsesCount()
      Returns number of uses - calls to get() method - since construction or last clear() call.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns boolean flag stating if refutation table is empty
      void put(GameState parent, GameState child)
      Adds new entry in refutation table for given move described by a (parent, child) pair.
      void reorder(GameState parent, java.util.List<GameState> children)
      Reorders the given list of children (for given parent) using information kept in refutation table.
      void reset()
      Resets the refutation table before next tree search iteration is started.
      void setDepthLimit(double depthLimit)
      Sets new depth limit (up to which entries are memorized).
      int size()
      Returns current size of refutation table (total number of entries in both 'save' and 'read' collections).

    • Method Detail

      • put

        void put(GameState parent,
       GameState child)
        Adds new entry in refutation table for given move described by a (parent, child) pair.
        Parameters:
        parent - reference to parent game state
        child - reference to child game state

      • reorder

        void reorder(GameState parent,
           java.util.List<GameState> children)
        Reorders the given list of children (for given parent) using information kept in refutation table. More precisely, this method is supposed to put in front the state that caused a cut-off in the previous search iteration. The counter of uses should be updated within this method call.
        Parameters:
        parent - reference to parent state
        children - list of references to children states

      • size

        int size()
        Returns current size of refutation table (total number of entries in both 'save' and 'read' collections).
        Returns:
        current size of refutation table

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns boolean flag stating if refutation table is empty
        Returns:
        boolean flag stating if refutation table is empty

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the whole transposition table.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the refutation table before next tree search iteration is started. This method is called by a game search algorithm in its execute() method and is meant to: (1) make the 'read collection' become the 'save collection' from the previous search (so that entries can be used by next search), and (2) emptify the 'save collection' (so that new entries can be collected in it in the next search).

      • getUsesCount

        int getUsesCount()
        Returns number of uses - calls to get() method - since construction or last clear() call.
        Returns:
        number of uses

      • getDepthLimit

        double getDepthLimit()
        Returns the depth limit (up to which entries are memorized).
        Returns:
        depth limit

      • setDepthLimit

        void setDepthLimit(double depthLimit)
        Sets new depth limit (up to which entries are memorized).
        Parameters:
        depthLimit - depth limit to be set
